summary: This document is an executive biography for the Warden of the Federal Correctional Institution (FCI) Otisville. It details his career progression within the Federal Bureau of Prisons, from starting as a Correctional Officer in 1994 to becoming Warden at FCI Otisville in 2019. The biography also notes his prior military service and educational background.

persons.name: Warden
persons.role: Warden of Federal Correctional Institution Otisville
persons.context: The subject of the executive biography, detailing his career progression within the Federal Bureau of Prisons, culminating in his appointment as Warden at FCI Otisville in 2019.

events.title: Career Start at FCI Schuylkill
events.description: The Warden began his career with the Federal Bureau of Prisons as a Correctional Officer at the Federal Correctional Institution (FCI) in Schuylkill, Pennsylvania.

events.title: Promotion to Witness Security Coordinator
events.description: The Warden was promoted and transferred to Washington, D.C., to serve as the Witness Security Coordinator.

events.title: Promotion to Deputy Regional Director
events.description: The Warden was promoted to Deputy Regional Director for the Northeast Region of the Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Appointment as Warden at FCI Otisville
events.description: The Warden was named the Warden of the Federal Correctional Institution (FCI) Otisville in Otisville, New York.

keyFacts: The document is an executive biography for the Warden of FCI Otisville, where Jeffrey Epstein was later held.
The Warden's career began in 1994 and he held positions including Correctional Officer, Case Manager, Unit Manager, and Witness Security Coordinator.
He served in the U.S. Army prior to his career with the Bureau of Prisons.
He holds a Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice from Pennsylvania State University.
He was named Warden at FCI Otisville in 2019, the year Jeffrey Epstein died there.
